header.relationships: Close family, partners, very close friends
header.topics: refueling, ambulances, past week, spirituality, food and drink, eat-by dates, cricket, illness, news, supermarkets, foreign languages, education, literature, text messages
header.conv_type: Discussing, explaining, inquiring, advising, requesting, anecdote telling, telling jokes

body.u: I went to Tesco's where I've gone for n number of years and probably been hundreds of times and I'm filling up as usual and suddenly instead of going to the car the petrol squirted came right up and then
yeah so had you pressed the thing that makes it come out?
yeah I was filling the car the petrol was the pump was working
yeah anand did it come out the the spout into the tank sort of thing?
the tank was filling as per normal but all of a sudden there was a huge pressure on my hand and the pump almost jumped out of the car you know where you put it and the petrol squirted up
yeah yeah yeah yes
and the petrol spurted up
gosh but had you filled your tank already or?
no I'd only got eleven pounds worth in and it takes forty pounds
gosh

so they were very I sort of staggered oh I staggered across the road and somebody said are you alright? no I'm not no I can't see I couldn't see out of my left eye at all and I could hardly see out of my right eye it was horrible
sso what did they do to you then?

well they took me into a little place and they washed my eye out with water just with water because they hadn't got anything else at that time and I think I was shouting all the time ah ah oh ah you know and then they called for the ambulance I said I didn't want the ambulance but apparently it is part of health and safety but maybe half an hour later the ambulance came they'd had to come from but they were lovely they took me into the ambulance and washed my eye out again
yes right yes right right yeah and so you did go in the ambulance?
no it was static
what?
it was static
so you went in the ambulance they sorted you out
yes and then they took me back to 's
oh is that where you'd come from?

no I ca ah it was easier than taking me home because III'd rang and he'd come over and taken the car and my pullover and stuff that was oh they were absolutely stinking I had to wash them out three times
oh right okay yeah I see yeah gosh
so that's my saga for the weekend I don't want any more thank you
gosh that must've been a bit so you must've got your petrol free then surely?
oh I offered to pay for it and the lady on the till was going to take some money and the manager said oh no
she was going to take the money blimey
the lady on the till she didn't know any better
oh dear

she's just the the person who takes the money but the manager said no that's all so I got it erm thirteen pounds worth of petrol but some of it was on the courtyard because as soon as the petrol hit me I dropped the pump
yeah yeah so you must get some compensation for that surely?

well thinks so I'm going to write and see I don't know it's kind of in the air because I get my petrol every time at the same place but I will think about compensation I'm supposed to write but I haven't done it yet
yeah yes yeah yeah we'll do that as soon as possible what else has happened in your week then?
well you ask me that question and I always have to dive into my handbag and get my diary out because I
was there nothing very memorable then that's happened?
well it can't be can it?
oh you must've just
oh I've had a very good weekend
yeah? did you win something on the Grand National or something?
no I didn't I went up to on a course
oh yeah
on and it was brilliant absolutely brilliant
was it good?
mm the people in the group were good and they had lots of talks lots of prayers lots of things
so what sort of form did it take? did you all go there?
well there were fifteen from around the country
yeah what whereabouts were they from?

er Norfolk London Wales erm one or two from Yorkshire and various places oh it were quite a lad a couple a very nice couple from Manchester that was we met you know in the normal meeting and greeting and talking and introducing
yeah yeah yeah but then is it silence after that?
no there was no silence we talked and we even had a bar at night
right oh in one of those rooms?
yeah have you been to ?
I have yeah
have you been to the ?
yes
that's lovely that's where the bar is just a little cupboard and you go and help yourself
yeah it's like a little room isn't it?
well I always
like the size of an airing cupboard maybe
airing airing cupboard plus size
yeah yeah
yeah it's good
I wonder at erm the that lemonade in the fridge must've been there years though surely?
oh don't I got it changed you know
yeah did you check the date before you drunk it?
no I don't ever do that I opened a tin of oh I can't think what they were oh peaches the other day at home when I got home and it was two thousand and eight and it was perfect
peaches? oh yeah blimey how do how do you er how well have you kept it for that long without noticing it?
oh I don't know don't ask me
where was it?
in the larder on the shelf
and it had been there since two
but
blimey

did I tell you a while ago I saw a programme on TV where they had found these Heinz erm Christmas puddings from Scott's Antarctic expedition? and they ate them all those sort of forty fifty years I think no sixty years later so two thousand and eight it is not going to kill me
yeah yeah yeah yeah yeah mm no
I don't look at dates
no I think people take them too seriously don't they? like
I suppose it's good business if I'd have thrown that tin away I would have had to buy another one
yeah well the idea is it's to stop you suing them saying I got food poisoning whereas the dates so they've got to be really careful and haven't they just in case something happened?
I don't know I don't I don't go into those sort of things
yeah that said it will be fine it doesn't instantly overnight just turn does it?
well your nose generally tells you
yeah oh your eyes?
er no normally it's your nose you know if it's a tin and either you are pulling it or you are putting a a tin opener in there's a if it's if it's off you know because it smells horribly
yeah mm
and what have you been up to this week?

erm on Monday I nothing in particular Tuesday well that was quite interesting I had there was I was a a bit stuck on Tuesday because I didn't know what was going to happen whether I was going to be going to the area cricket trials in
right and did you?
I didn't no I had to go somewhere else instead I had to go to Ripon with the music department to pick up this violin off the lady you know sort of near Morrisons so we went there
eurgh so that was the lady wha
you know I told you about
yes
yeah
tell me again I keep forgetting
well she her husband had died and she was full of this violin that he had I talked to her about how good it was and then we had to collect that off her because she was giving it to us
yes mm mm your mum or school?
no me and the music teachers so I was a bit disappointed about that really
why?
because I could've been at the trials and playing for the area and I'd have got a little thing for my blazer that says cricket on it still never mind
ah ah ah well does this mean you won't get a chance again?

it means I won't be able to play for but it doesn't bother me too much I mean I can play for clubs and schools and things so that doesn't matter I'm not too bothered about that but still we went to get the instrument from the lady in it was quite fun the the journey and everything and erm getting there and she gave us it and she really enjoyed it and we asked her to come back to the the concert in summer and there we said you can have a bowl of strawberries I didn't know she was allergic to strawberries and we said you can have a bowl of raspberries and cream but she's allergic to cream so she so we are just going to get her a bowl of raspberries yeah and then she gave us all the stuff so I have to sort through that and the fiddle's is thing
mm yes oh dear oh dear well is it music as well?

yeah there's a bit of that which I'm going to see for the orchestra which they can have and there's a music stand as well but I've left that with them a tuning fork as well that I've kept and a couple of bows as well which are handy I suppose because you can I've always been worried about one of my bows breaking erm so if I've got a spare that's a lot easier and then Wednesday erm just a normal Wednesday really and yesterday we had a match after school against
mm right yes mm mm mm mm ah cricket?

yeah but that was really disappointing because our batsman didn't really get going at the start and the wicket was really hard to bowl off because it was just like a flat bit of carpet in the middle of a field where you're running in your spikes then all of a sudden half way through your run up there's like a carpet so you have to adapt to that so it's difficult to bowl on and plus they had this one person who looked about twenty-five he was hammered
mm was he a sixth former?

no no they had to he had to be in year ten but he looked about twenty-five he just palmed him off somewhere and he didn't really have any skill but he just had brute force that at our age that's all you need really
well I wouldn't have thought that brute force would've enabled you to hit the ball yes when you've actually hit it
yeah well that's the thing yeah
yeah

and there were two of us who were bowling well but the other people didn't really and one of our players didn't turn up either so if we play them as our teacher said if we play them again we'd beat them every single time after that but it was just that first time they took us by surprise with it because just like the way they played and everything it was really different
well they had the advantage it was their field
well you don't really find that to be honest that's not really a
but you just said it was like a piece of carpet and you had to
yeah but they but they had to play off it as well so they had the difficulty
but if it was theirs they're used to it
no because we have a carpet at our school and we really hate it and it you you just can't get used to it I know what you mean but it's just impossible to get used to
it's not an actual carpet is it?
yeah it's a carpet
or is it grass? you know artificial
it's well it's like a carpet of green grass
artificial?
yeah so it's a carpet

and so
yeah and I want to do one but then I feel sorry for the other so I'm just going to have to decide
you can't play for both?
no they play on the same night I'm afraid
oh well
